website_summaries.verdict: A premium satellite TV antenna that offers more service features and hands-free functions than most other options.
pros: Comes with the full lineup of Dish standard and high definition channels and services
Compatibility with two receivers mean you can hook up multiple televisions in the same RV as well
cons: Direct line-of-sight is required for the best signal reception

customer_reviews.title: Wally + Winegard antenna is a beautiful thing to behold!
customer_reviews.text: Easy, flawless installation on first attempt. Picture on TV is beautiful 1080p HD. The Wally works just like our Hopper does at home, so there is no "learning" curve at all. Antenna is light weight, yet sturdy. We set it up on the tripod we purchased along with the antenna, made sure the handle was pointing north, and it found all three western arc satellites as promised. It took approximately 30 minutes from set up to TV watching what with all the software downloading. IN short, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Scintor

customer_reviews.title: If you live on the east coast, especially the Northeast this is the one for you
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the only portable automatic satellite dishs that I'm aware of that can utilize both the Eastern arc satellites as well as the Western arc satellites. Most portable dishes can only access the Western arc. It's a little bit bigger and a ittle bit heavier than its competitors but if you live anywhere on the East Coast and camp anywhere where there's trees this is a good pick to insure you can get a signal.
customer_reviews.author: Midlo

customer_reviews.title: We got this because it has the biggest reflector of any of the portable dishes and brings in a great picture.
customer_reviews.text: This is HUGE! We got this because it has the biggest reflector of any of the portable dishes and brings in a great picture. On Further Edit: As we got to doing more traveling with this dish we have found that the Wally receiver that came with it in this package deal will only support this dish on a 25 foot RG6 cable hooked direct to the receiver. Any more than that and it will not hold the dish on the sat. We changed back to the V211 and it is working fine on over 50 foot of cable. X2 is great Wally is very poor to work the dish.
customer_reviews.author: MI Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After looking for a mobile solution for our 5th wheel we found the pathway X2. Pros: No power cord needed Gets western and eastern arcs Very stable in high winds with tripod 211 receiver becomes a DVR with your own cheap external HD Extremely easy first time setup Automatically finds the satellite, no need to enter elevation. Can support 2 TVs on different channels Cons: Won't mount on ladder Will edit this review and add more cons when we find them It's been a month and we love this system
customer_reviews.author: Admiral

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match for the Winegard Pathway X2 PA6002R Satellite TV Antenna
customer_reviews.text: If your having trouble finding a storage bag for the Winegard Pathway X2 PA6002R Satellite TV Antenna, the Heavy Ready 18 x 22" (Height x Diameter) Padded Kick Drum Bag by Protec, Model HR1822 was a perfect solution for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Donna k

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, Great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I just got it and hooked it up to me Trailer using the outside cable hook up. put it outside with cables facing north (I live in SoCal) I have Dish Wally with pay as you go. It took about 15min to dial it self in and programmed the receiver. Called Dish to activate receiver. Done !!! This has the bigger refractor means HD comes in great. Smaller refractor means SD. Get this one save the trouble of returning other products.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Guy

customer_reviews.title: East and West USA satellites
customer_reviews.text: Perfect reception with clear sky. Struggles a bit in heavy cloud during setup, but holds well if running when clouds arrive. Perfect reception and picture best we’ve seen. We made our own setup problems by installing splitter, but once we ran through successful setup it is great. Actively re positions all day for best reception. Only down are several minute waits with screens that don’t inform you it’s working. Patience is only method. Used DISH CHAT tech for first problems. Worked well. Waiting to get some time on it to see if it stands up over time. We chose XP2 because we travel to both east/west USA.
customer_reviews.author: esm

customer_reviews.title: Beware with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have had trouble with my unit losing satellite connection. The company finally let me ship it in for inspection and repairs. They shipped it back and said no defects found. Evidently the problem is I was the length of my coax cable was longer than 15 feet and was not directly connected to the Wally. I connected it to the satellite in connector on trailer which added more cable length to the connection. I do not use it very often because I have fish anywhere. As long as I have an Internet connection or provided tv service at RV park I don’t use it much.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W.

customer_reviews.title: It is great when it works but can be a challenge to ...
customer_reviews.text: It is great when it works but can be a challenge to get it to work. Winegard technical absolutely stinks. After long waits on the phone to talk to someone, they take your phone number. The first time I never heard back, a week later I had issues and called, waited and waited, left my number and they finally called back around 24 hours later. Same with email support, once no reply, the second time a half hearted response a day later. Apparently they don't realize people can be without TV service for a day waiting for a call back. Option, call DISH TV, those people don't have a clue and will out and out lie to you.
customer_reviews.author: Generator bill

customer_reviews.title: Winegard Terrible, Terrible Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Antenna worked great until there was “self inflicted “ damage to base of unit. There is a plastic sprocket that holds the base to upper part. I reached out to Winegard to purchase this damaged part and they refuse to sell me part. Their only option was to send it to them for repair which would cost near what an entire new unit would cost. Really feel like this is terrible customer service by Winegard!! Strongly suggest buying product from companies that care about customer service , obviously not Winegard!!
customer_reviews.author: nanabon

customer_reviews.title: Great Maiden Voyage
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box like a charm. You need to be patient if you have new receiver(s) as it will take a few (in our case maybe 10) minutes to provision the receiver. Once the receiver has been authorized the PA-6002 immediately went to work finding satellites. Worked like a champ. Set up 2 new receivers and it works smoothly both times. Great improvement over the original tailgater.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bennett

customer_reviews.title: We got the lemon
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bundle so we could enjoy our dish while we work over the road. Setting it up the first time was easy. This April when we went back out to work. We set it up like we did last time. The only difference is we have a different camper spot. Same park same town. It takes anywhere from 30 minutes to 7 hours to get any tv at all. We have to go through the setup on the Wally multiple times PER day. This is ridiculous it's not even a year old.
customer_reviews.author: becky bakke

customer_reviews.title: Love it- works well, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well when our roof mounted traveler can’t get signals due to trees. Easy to set up but does take awhile while it rotates around looking for the satellites. Even worked in heavy rainfall. Although 25 ft is supposed to be cable limit, bought a 150ft high performance phat coax cable to reach an open area near a lake and it worked great. Also bought the stand and a kick drum case to carry it in when traveling. A trick to reset is to go to settings on dish receiver and pick reset Wally when it lost signal after being moved.
customer_reviews.author: Nanci D

customer_reviews.title: Inspect Upon Receiving
customer_reviews.text: I'm keeping this review nuetral. Great item in theory, bought two for two receivers on separate satellites. One dish will run two receivers but they have to be viewing the same satellite. As of yet, I can't get either to stay locked on for more than several hours. Under perfect conditions, they set up, run a few hours and lose all sense of where they're at. Frustrated. Update - I still cannot get this dish to stay locked on. Took the front cover off and found the reflectior has a big dent in it. Should have done this upon receiving it. Junk....
customer_reviews.author: Micheal

customer_reviews.title: It's not plug and play
customer_reviews.text: It's not plug and play because I have put in 8 hours trying to get it to play. Rerunning all my cable inside my rv. Nobody in tech support wants to talk about it.. Really frazzled. Trying it one more time if its a no go it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: DondiG

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase! Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Spent over 17 hours trying to get this to work in our RV. 5 of those hours were on the phone with tech support. Finally they decided the dish was faulty and we sent back. No way I wanted another one. I'm very tech savvy and this by far was the worst tech experience I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: charles murray

customer_reviews.title: Great device.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device, positions itself, takes about 10 minutes max. The only issue is trying to get local programing and having to call Dish is a pain in the rear, mainly because most don't know how or what to do. Only had an issue once during rain storm lost picture, rain drops laying on surface causing distortion then not signal. Thought about waxing the surface so water runs off, have not tried it yet.
customer_reviews.author: KFM

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning about this antenna. I like the dual arc feature but still am have problems getting it positioned to work around tree branches in RV parks. A few inches in any direction can make a difference. I would have hoped that once it found all three satellites that the "head" would stay in that position. Apparently it is always making small direction positions and occasionally drives itself way off the beam, loosing all signal. Once it is locked on, it seems to do well in providing good signal.
customer_reviews.author: chasfm11

customer_reviews.title: No problem finding the Satellites...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. The only bad part was it did not work with the cable hook up on the outside of our new motorhome. So we ran the cable in directly. Luckily we were able to go through the battery opening and ran it up through the bench for the table. So we did not have to go through a window or anything. I love the remote, it can be used anywhere, you don't have to aim it directly at the box. So you can use it to change the channel in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Cbreeze475

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. Works during storms. All it needs is a small opening in the trees. When I say small mine has had like a three foot opening and it worked fine. Point the handle to the north and let it do the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Debra W

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Playmaker
customer_reviews.text: So far this Pathway X2 is much better than our previous Playmaker probably due to the larger dish. It is somewhat larger but light enough to handle. I had to rearrange things in our 5th wheel to store it, not a problem. It takes a little longer to find the signals and once it does it holds them well. The signal strength is much better than the previous dish. We have not connected to the Eastern ARC because the Western has been available.
customer_reviews.author: David Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Dish is very good, avoid the VIP211Z package if for RV use
customer_reviews.text: Great signal strength, it has worked thru rain strorms, CAUTION: The package with the VIP211Z does NOT have a connector for TV cable, I had to buy a $40 adapter, not good for RV use, Get the VIP211K receiver that does have the TV cable connector.
customer_reviews.author: jerryeasthartford

customer_reviews.title: Our X2 will operate properly only when using a single ...
customer_reviews.text: Our X2 will operate properly only when using a single length of RG6. One end of the cable must be plugged into the connector on the satellite dish and the other end of the same cable must be plugged DIRECTLY into the receiver. No splices or connectors of any kind may be between the satellite dish and the receiver - NONE!!! We cannot use two pieces of cable with a splice and we cannot use a cable connection on a wall plate. Other than this limitation, the system works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: RDFCT

customer_reviews.title: When the Dish on top of the RV can not ...
customer_reviews.text: When the Dish on top of the RV can not find the Satellites because of overhead cover, I use this one to place out onto a clear spot to the sky and sit back and watch my Dishnetwork stations. Works every time with out fail or hassle.
customer_reviews.author: sgmjack35

customer_reviews.title: The equipment works great and if you don't mind having to make a ...
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it 4 stars because of the issues I have with DISH. The equipment works great and if you don't mind having to make a phone call everytime you move (if you want local news) it is a great unit. I've only used it with the western satellites, but it is supposed to be able to connect with the satellites on the east coast. Equipment is excellent, having to call Dish to change zip code sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred L Stockton

customer_reviews.title: 1 receiver excellent! 2 receivers limited viewing.
customer_reviews.text: Good dish with simple setup. But beware adding a second receiver like me. I have two wally boxes hooked up. The second wally loses most of the hd channels and a lot of channels that are on the first receiver just aren't there. So most of them are only in sd only. Some of the premium channels won't be there either. They also charge 7$ a month for the second box. The picture and sound on the first box are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!!
customer_reviews.text: After some use and travel between WA and AZ I find this system wanting. Dish has been good but Winegard has been terrible. Getting the dish to work after moving it’s position is NOT easy. Signal is not impressive and I have the new Wally that puts out 18 volts. I could go on but easier to say: Stay away!! Setup was a breeze. Getting Dish to activate it not so good. Had to be transferred twice to find someone familiar with the setup. Bad day for them?
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Eureka, it works. We're not tethered to an RV park's cables.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't called Winegard tech support so I can't say about that. But the unit is easy to assemble, install (we use a tripod on the ground) and super easy to use. but of course the only drawback is that it is DISH-network only. We live in an RV and it has been useful. The people at DISH will talk you through the commissioning process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the satellite for the job we needed. Be sure to check when you purchase whether you are on the Eastern or Western arc, and order accordingly. We learned from experience that it did matter - fortunately we were able to return the first satellite that we ordered and get this one instead! It wasn't too difficult to set up and we were able to get all the channels we needed
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Also works on the East coast!
customer_reviews.text: In a nutshell, it works! Had a KVH R5 in-motion dome that quit one to many times! I decided that the Pathway X2 was the way to go! We travel both East & West coasts. The X2 will let you select the Eastern OR Western arc satellites. The X1 ONLY will lock on to the Western arc birds, not good on the East coast!. Hva had this antenna for a couple weeks now & so far so good. I have been putting it on the roof but someday soon I'll use the 25' of coax when I end up under trees.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I had to write a review because I abused this product and it still works great. While camping with my rv I was in a spot with too many trees for my dish to get service. I got up on my fender and tried to swing the dish onto my rv roof. The product crashed 10 feet landing on gravel. Then it kept rolling down a mountain side bouncing and rolling (it is a sphere) over 2000 ft down the mountain side dropping vertically 8 or 900 feet before crashing into a large log. It still works.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: it's a great antenna and receiver package
customer_reviews.text: Although we've only had this for a few days, it's a great antenna and receiver package! Comes with remote. A lot of features and benifits - switching g between the different arcs depending on what view is available is a great benifit.
customer_reviews.author: ajk170

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Spent two days troubleshooting this thing. Went through every conceivable variable that would prevent it from picking up any signal whatsoever. Waste of time and money. Thankfully I'm still within my window to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but beware
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but beware, use your own wits in hooking up and connecting, because the support tech people don't know didly. Had a few issues, and figured out what they were on my own. Also not, yes the X2 will automatically find the signals for you, but believe me, it takes a while to configure, then process the info before you get tv.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constant loss of signal
customer_reviews.text: Used it on our first vacation in Arkansas. Could not watch any channel for more than 5 minutes without losing signal
customer_reviews.author: Fireman749

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Seems as though it is easier to get set up than the Pathway was. It does have a much larger dish than the Pathway and will work with both western and eastern arc satellites.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far-however the wally software MUST be downloaded from a stationary dish, not the portable one that comes with this package, would be nice if they put that on the box or directions lol.
customer_reviews.author: rrapidron

customer_reviews.title: Now that is Great Customer Service...Going above & beyond.!
customer_reviews.text: This works in an area that is hard to get signal in Lake Mead National Park. Good investment. My husband & I are not the brightest when it comes to computers etc so this probably took us a bit longer then others but with Tech Support we were up & going in no time. Tech stayed on phone with me till We were up & running.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Igo

customer_reviews.title: Love this Satellite Antenna!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a Tailgater with this and it is so much better! I'm kicking myself for not buying the additional receiver available when I ordered! This system allows watching 2 tvs with two receivers. This even works in rainy conditions. Takes a hard rain to lose picture. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Pittman

customer_reviews.title: No obvious quality control
customer_reviews.text: Definately ANOTHER lapse in quality control through Amazon warehouse. Item came in far worse condition than advertised, including not working at picking up satellites. Error messages abound. Come on Amazon, really!!!
customer_reviews.author: az jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent satellite dish
customer_reviews.text: I love this satellite dish. Easy to install. It basically sets itself. Takes about 15 minutes. Excellent customer service on dish. We have the Pay as You Go service on Dish. Not Inexpensive but worth every penny. Been running for a month without a glitch even in stormy weather.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy Dickie

customer_reviews.title: Great satellite dish. Lousy Dish software.
customer_reviews.text: Heads up people. The dish is great and pulls in a strong signal. It’s easy to install. The problem starts when you install a second receiver. We have Wallys and there is a Dish software glitch that Dish has been working to fix for several months. Our second receiver will not consistently transmit all the channels we’re paying for each month. They say a fix is coming soon. Just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bean

customer_reviews.title: Eh, hit or miss reception, HD fuzzes in and out.
customer_reviews.text: In Colorado - at the cabin it picks up 3 of 4 satellites (9000'), at the main house it only picks up 2 of 4 satellites (6000') and both locations have super clear view of the southern sky. HD fuzzes out all the time. It sort works? It sorta does not. Kinda disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Multi Arc Satelitte Antenna
customer_reviews.text: We use the Pathway X2 in our RV when trees obstruct the rooftop antenna. We had a Tailgater but too often we could not receive a signal from satellite 129 so no hd. Now with the ability to receive signals from the Eastern arc too we are almost never without a great high def picture.
customer_reviews.author: don benson

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Works 50% of the time or less
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Works 50% of the time or less. Perfectly clear view of the southern sky, dish in my home works. This rarely does. Bought to use while camping. Completely destroys the ability to relax. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME UNLESS YOU WANT CONSTANT AGGRAVATION! Where do I go warranty replacement???
customer_reviews.author: J.M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product!
customer_reviews.text: Our 7 year-old Winegard Carryout antenna had begun to not pick-up the Dish signal in some places. After talking with techs at both Dish and Winegard, it was determined that softwear changes in Dish satellites was the cause. A new antenna was the only solution. The Dish Outdoors recommended the Pathway. We connected the new Pathway antenna, which was fairly quick and easy, and it locked in on a signal in less than 2 minutes. We now have perfect HD reception! The Pathway antenna is an excellent device at a modest price.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Dang handy to have Eastern and Wester arcs. This ...
customer_reviews.text: Dang handy to have Eastern and Wester arcs. This saved me for the SEC CG in DT atlanta when a skyscraper had me on one side and in Jacksonville when an oak tree had me on the other. IT FINDS ITS OWN SIGNAL!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for East and West Coast satellites
customer_reviews.text: I started with a dish playmaker had a lot of problems since it's only access is West Coast satellites. This access is the East Coast satellites and West Coast and works as it should. They shouldn't even sell playmaker on the East Coast
customer_reviews.author: donnie jim

customer_reviews.title: Better signal and easier to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Winegard Pathway x2 was what we needed to get a good signal. Easier to use then the kingpro 1 satellite we had. Able to get 3 signals verse 1 signal. Worth the money. Very happy with the package deal.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Wally and antenna works great. Very happy. Only drawback is this unit can’t be roof mounted permanently and it’s larger than others. I knew this when I purchased it. The larger dish gets a very good signal.
customer_reviews.author: MTwigg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works for me. ability to work on east and west sats is great
customer_reviews.author: Stanley G Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect reception
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for anybody in an area where rabbit ears don't work and you need TV reception. This is slightly larger than other models but the good side is that it can receive both East and West satellite signals which is a bonus if you travel a lot. Don't expect too much assistance from Winegard or from Dish and then you'll not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Joy

customer_reviews.title: So far....
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that we were to get the Wally receiver and received the 211. Not cool. Ad clearly stated the Wally.
customer_reviews.author: A Bennett

customer_reviews.title: LOOOOOVVVVVEEEE IT
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT, easy to set up and at 10,000 feet above sea level in the Colorado mountains works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Duane Back

customer_reviews.title: A solid performer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality unit. The setup is easy. Signal strength is as good as a Dish 1000. The one bug I found was when the receiver goes into sleep mode overnight, the Winegard forgets it's setting and will sit stuck on the last satellite it was aimed at. If you want to change channels that are on a different satellite position you have to reboot the receiver. The Winegard uses about 8 watts. [...]
customer_reviews.author: David  P. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have the cube and this unit is so much better. The problem with the cube is if there were a lot of trees the signal would be blocked. This unit will pick up the western or eastern ark. Also the dish is larger. This gives you a better chance of picking up a signal.
customer_reviews.author: Bart W. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had tried other satellite systems and was quite discouraged. Then I got my Pathway X2... Within an hour I had a fix on the Dish satellites and was able to start watching TV. It's also a nice size and easy to store when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. LACROIX

customer_reviews.title: The satellite works great, was glad that I purchased this one that ...
customer_reviews.text: The satellite works great, was glad that I purchased this one that receives both eastern and western satellites. Depending on our RV site I've set it up using both. Instructions for setting it up and changing satellites could be a little clearer. Only complaint is on Dish, the program guide most of the time only shows what is coming on for the next hour, further out shows "not available".
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: Gets signal where others don't. Big but put a strap on handle to carry on to RV rooftop. When fully locked you get better picture. Finds satellites faster than older models, much more stable in wind with or without tripod. Better in inclement weather due to large dish size.
customer_reviews.author: Photogf4

customer_reviews.title: Great portable Dish
customer_reviews.text: Sets up quickly and the onscreen set-up is quick and easy. Great when you need to move the satellite dish away from obstructions
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: low volume, bad support
customer_reviews.text: sound level out of the Wally receiver is too low. Tried to contact Dish but after being passed from antenna mfr to dish then waiting for a long time they disconnected on me. While talking to antenna rep she let me know that she was experiencing the same problem
customer_reviews.author: gus

customer_reviews.title: A Great Choice for a Satellite TV
customer_reviews.text: This choice has been a good one. Works well and it is fully automatic. A simple coax that runs to the Wally and no power cord. Plug in Wally and hook up the coax to your TV or input on your trailer and away it goes.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Porter

customer_reviews.title: TThis just does not work for us!  It will not hold reception ! And yesterday just quit doing that
customer_reviews.text: I am really really upset about this satellite - it has been so difficult to work with. One minute it works great and then the next it shuts down - and finally yesterday it quit receiving anything! I paid way too much money for something that does not work right! I want my money back ! and I am goiing to pursue that - yesterday was a big football watching day for us and it just quit picking up anything! So we had to leave our camper and come home to get reception. Sick of it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Missing receiver from the bundle - no satisfaction yet!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Wingard "BUNDLE" , satellite and receiver. Recommended by a friend who is very happy with theirs. Received earlier than expected on August7th......yay! Unfortunately we are missing the receiver. I sent notification to the seller and received the starndard automated response. I have not heard anything since. I just want the receiver that was included in the purchase. I can only give 1 star since I haven't been able to set it up and use it!! Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: cindy ritter

customer_reviews.title: Its Great
customer_reviews.text: I can not belive how great this thing works!!! We got it for a motorhome and its like watching TV at home, but out in the woods. I would and will recommend the Winegard Pathway to all our RV friends.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Blindauer

product_meta.title: Winegard Pathway X2 PA6002R Satellite TV Antenna and DISH Wally Receiver Bundle (Dual Arc, 2 TV Viewing)
product_meta.description: Style:Satellite TV Antenna and receiverDesigned exclusively for DISH Network satellite TV programming, the Pathway X2 antenna offers a whole new look at automatic satellite TV acquisition. Powered through the DISH receiver, the Pathway X2 requires no separate power cord. Simply activate the receiver through an existing DISH account or subscribe to a new Pay-As-You-Go programming package that doesn?t require any activation fees or 2 year agreements. A unique feature to the Pathway is the ability to point to either Western or Eastern arc satellite orbitals, offering the most programming available. The larger reflector size also provides superior signal performance compared to other automatic portable satellite systems. Lightweight yet rugged, the Pathway X2 antenna offers the fastest and easiest set up. Features 2 coax inputs to allow for multiple receiver hook-up, an easy grip carry handle, and a security eyelet molded into the base so the antenna can be locked up. Includes one 25? coax cable. Stores to 15? x 21?. Weight 16 lbs. Compatible with Carryout tripod mount (sold separately). Not compatible with Carryout ladder mount. Made in the U.S.A. Antenna Directivity - Directional
feature_bullets: Dual Arc technology receives both Western and Eastern arcs for maximum SD/HD DISH programming throughout the US in all weather conditions
Optimized for 2 TV seamless viewing, receives programming from satellite 72.7 when connected to 2 receivers

Receives standard and high definition DISH programming and is compatible with DISH pay-as-you-go programming.Clean the reflector cover with a soft cloth, water, and dish soap to avoid scratching the cover
100% automatic, set your state and the X2 will do the rest! Powered through the coax, just one wire with no power cable needed
